body_html:
Yes there are different approaches but just to make an example:
http://www.erogol.com/online-hard-example-mining-pytorch/

With high level api i.e. estimators, if we want to automate this process, we need a way to let estimators to interact with the dataset api and its iterators to handle hard cases mining.

There was also an old request on Keras: keras-team/keras#6569

See also OHEM section in https://arxiv.org/pdf/1604.03540.pdf

With high level api i.e. estimators, if we want to automate this process, we need a way to let estimators to interact with the dataset api and its iterators to handle hard cases mining.

body:
Yes there are different approaches but just to make an example:
http://www.erogol.com/online-hard-example-mining-pytorch/

With high level api i.e. estimators, if we want to automate this process, we need a way to let estimators to interact with the dataset api and its iterators to handle hard cases mining.

There was also an old request on Keras: https://github.com/keras-team/keras/issues/6569

See also OHEM section in https://arxiv.org/pdf/1604.03540.pdf
